verses.verse: “O My people, what (Is. 5:4; Jer. 2:5, 31) have I done to you? And how have I (Is. 43:22, 23; Mal. 1:13) wearied you? Testify against Me.
((Deut. 4:20)) For I brought you up from the land of Egypt, I redeemed you from the house of bondage; And I sent before you Moses, Aaron, and Miriam.

O My people, remember now What (Num. 22:5, 6; Josh. 24:9) Balak king of Moab counseled, And what Balaam the son of Beor answered him, From Acacia Grove to Gilgal, That you may know (Judg. 5:11) the righteousness of the LORD.”
With what shall I come before the LORD, And bow myself before the High God? Shall I come before Him with burnt offerings, With calves a year old?

(Ps. 50:9; Is. 1:11) Will the LORD be pleased with thousands of rams, Ten thousand (Job 29:6) rivers of oil? (Lev. 18:21; 20:1-5; 2 Kin. 16:3; Jer. 7:31; Ezek. 23:37) Shall I give my firstborn for my transgression, The fruit of my body for the sin of my soul?

He has ((Deut. 10:12; 1 Sam. 15:22); Hos. 6:6; 12:6) shown you, O man, what is good; And what does the LORD require of you But (Gen. 18:19; Is. 1:17) to do justly, To love mercy, And to walk humbly with your God?
(Punishment of Israel’s Injustice) The LORD’s voice cries to the city— Wisdom shall see Your name: “Hear the rod! Who has appointed it?
Are there yet the treasures of wickedness In the house of the wicked, And the short measure that is an abomination?
Shall I count pure those with (Lev. 19:36; Hos. 12:7) the wicked scales, And with the bag of deceitful weights?
For her rich men are full of (Is. 1:23; 5:7; Amos 6:3, 4; Mic. 2:1, 2) violence, Her inhabitants have spoken lies, And (Jer. 9:2-6, 8; Hos. 7:13; Amos 2:4) their tongue is deceitful in their mouth.
“Therefore I will also (Lev. 26:16; Ps. 107:17) make you sick by striking you, By making you desolate because of your sins.
(Lev. 26:26) You shall eat, but not be satisfied; Hunger shall be in your midst. You may carry some away, but shall not save them; And what you do rescue I will give over to the sword.
“You shall (Deut. 28:38-40; Amos 5:11; Zeph. 1:13; Hag. 1:6) sow, but not reap; You shall tread the olives, but not anoint yourselves with oil; And make sweet wine, but not drink wine.

For the statutes of (1 Kin. 16:25, 26) Omri are (1 Kin. 16:30; 21:25, 26; 2 Kin. 21:3; Hos. 5:11) kept; All the works of Ahab’s house are done; And you walk in their counsels, That I may make you a desolation, And your inhabitants a hissing. Therefore you shall bear the (Is. 25:8) reproach of My people.”

(Sorrow for Israel’s Sins) Woe is me! For I am like those who gather summer fruits, Like those who (Is. 17:6) glean vintage grapes; There is no cluster to eat Of the first-ripe fruit which (Is. 28:4; Hos. 9:10) my soul desires.
The (Ps. 12:1; Is. 57:1) faithful man has perished from the earth, And there is no one upright among men. They all lie in wait for blood; (Hab. 1:15) Every man hunts his brother with a net.
That they may successfully do evil with both hands— The prince asks for gifts, The judge seeks a (Amos 5:12; Mic. 3:11) bribe, And the great man utters his evil desire; So they scheme together.
The best of them is (Is. 55:13; Ezek. 2:6) like a brier; The most upright is sharper than a thorn hedge; The day of your watchman and your punishment comes; Now shall be their perplexity.
(Jer. 9:4) Do not trust in a friend; Do not put your confidence in a companion; Guard the doors of your mouth From her who lies in your (Deut. 28:56) bosom.
For (Matt. 10:36; Mark 3:21; Luke 8:19; John 7:5) son dishonors father, Daughter rises against her mother, Daughter-in-law against her mother-in-law; A man’s enemies are the men of his own household.
